body: Cannot reproduce. What is the exact width and height of the terminal in cells?

I can reliably reproduce (every single time I've tried) at 1274 cols, and 262 lines, if I zoom back in to 959x233 then it does not crash. Let me see if I can grab a debug build so I can upload a core dump and get you a line it happens on.

Try alacritty, most terminals definitely cap your zoom out earlier than that. (I'm also on a 3840x2160 display @ 1x scale so I may be able to zoom out further).

When running a debug build in gdb on latest master I found that this assert fails.
```
/neovim/src/nvim/ui_compositor.c:546: ui_comp_raw_line: Assertion `attrs[i] >= 0' failed.
```

Heres a link to the line: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/3b54adc6c6d25dd146fa1eac21321f6bd612f50a/src/nvim/ui_compositor.c#L546

When I first reported this my understanding wasn't complete, the actual issue here is resizing with large horizontal output it seems. Here's a functional test that reliably reproduces this issue. I'm going to see if I can spend some time over the next few days trying find the issue here.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/8541a0839a16b52b714328b35ebdc437dd6d9b36

```
  it('does not crash on zoomout with large output #30374', function()
    skip(is_os('win'))

    feed([[:terminal<cr>]])
    -- Start terminal smaller.
    screen:try_resize(100, 100)
    command('call jobresize(b:terminal_job_id, 100, 100)')

    -- Generate very wide output.
    feed("ifor i in $(seq 1 1000); do echo -n $i; done\r\n")

    -- Make terminal big.
    screen:try_resize(2000, 2000)
    command('call jobresize(b:terminal_job_id, 2000, 2000)')

    assert_alive()
  end)
```

Quick update on this:

So it seems like the reason for this is because of this constant:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/9c9c7ae30f50685e62984084767905c7d456cdd9/src/nvim/drawline.h#L12

We limit the max terminal highlight attributes to 1024, but the UI compositor doesn't account for this here:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/3b54adc6c6d25dd146fa1eac21321f6bd612f50a/src/nvim/ui_compositor.c#L546

As well as in a few other locations. I'm currently trying to figure out how I can make sure that we don't go past this index in the ScreenGrid's highlight attributes in terminals.

I've got a working solution to this issue:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/compare/master...The-Briel-Deal:large_term_crash

I'm going to wait to make a PR until I can look a little deeper and verify these are the only occurrences of going past `TERM_MAX_ATTRS`. This fixes the crash with my tests of the 5,000col 5,000row terminal window when printing roughly 30,000 chars. But when I bring the tests up to 50,000col 50,000row term, I get a separate crash here:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/3d1f907912e25cb7a83163423c75dc67a0aea126/src/nvim/terminal.c#L1974

I'm currently thinking that is unrelated to the current issue but I haven't looked super deep into it yet.
